comment: His lectures are interesting, but he mainly reads off slides while going deeper on the subject, 10 in class one pagers randomly assigned, 4 short response quizes, 1 major paper due at the end. Doesn't post slides online, either go to class or hope someone else took the notes and is willing to share. Good teacher, takes pride in his teachings

Good professor, taught an interesting Understanding Latin America class. Attendance is mandatory, but it's not a dealbreaker to miss a class. Class had a reasonable mix of assignment types, informative lectures, closed note tests in-class (not hard), and good extra credit. The textbook isn't completely necessary but it helps a lot with the tests!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Took Dr. Rudy for Understanding Latin America a few years ago. Super kind professor who makes class easy. Just show up to lecture, take notes, and study. Tests, quizzes, and mini-writing assignments are not difficult.

Easy workload. Tests and quizzes are all in person, so be aware of that. Quizzes are short response, not multiple choice. 
There are 4 quizzes total, but they are all vocab-based, so just study. An essay toward the end of the semester, but you will have almost 3 months to complete it. Minute papers are an easy 10 pts because they're opinionated.

good interesting lectures. cares about his teaching and is very helpful. there is not much room for error as participation only makes up small percent of your grade. rest is all short answer quizzes two exams and a rough draft/final draft paper. grades the paper. hard and tests over small details from the lecture I doubt anyone in my class got an A

Great professor, one paper throughout the semester, and you're given more than enough time for it, minute papers through-out the semester that are basically just tickets out the door, a few quizzes, and two exams all very very easy; gives great study guides.

Dr. Rudy was very caring towards students and made sure to make everything as easy to understand as possible. Tests are relatively easy as long as you study the vocabulary, which is what tests are almost entirely based off of. Always go to class even if it's not mandatory because presentations are not available online.

He is a good professor. Just always go to class even though its not mandatory to. Be ready to write a lot of notes, he does not post his powerpoints on d2l. Be ready to memorize definitions on the chapters he tells you to study for quizzes. He gives a few extra credits. There is a group project at the end. The mid term and final are easy just study
He was a good professor. His lectures are very boring so be prepared for that.

He has 4 quizzes and 10 1-2 paragraph papers that are really easy. a midterm and a final. he is really easy to pass as long as you kind of understand what he is talking about. i recommend taking it online

This class is an easy A. You have 10-minute papers that are about a paragraph to a page long, you have 4 quizzes that are definition-based, there is a final paper, and a midterm and final for this class. Overall, easy class, definition heavy, should be an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Class is basically based on remembering terms. Graded off attendance, 10 short opinionated minute papers (about a paragraph or little longer), 4 easy, short, straight to the point quizzes, 1 four page essay, a mid term (easy, very vocab based), and a final.

He is a really funny and nice professor. In class, he was really involved in helping all students. There are 4 quizzes and the midterm and final. There is also a paper due at the end of the semester. He was really harsh on grading the papers, but left really good feedback. The quizzes are easy, and overall an easy class to take.
this class was super interesting. as long as you attend class and take notes, you should do well. we did have to do minute papers and an essay but I didnt find it too difficult.

super easy. Just make sure you show up because he does minute papers where you respond to the lecture and theyre just attendance grades. Take your notes and pay attention and its a super easy A. The only hard thing is you have to do an immigrant narrative paper that has mini due dates throughout the semester but that was easy to.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very easy class! Show up and take notes from his lectures, and you'll be fine. He's very caring, professional, and has a cool vibe (he usually plays groovy music to start class). He warns you of pop quizzes and provides good study guides for the tests. We watched a few good videos too! I enjoyed this class and highly recommend it.

Hes a great teacher. All you have to do is take notes and look after them for like 10 minutes before a quiz. Theres only 4 quizes and two tests. The class is easy and does not require a book, homework or access code.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Easy class, basically all definitions. Not graded by much, but the assignments are pretty easy. Attendance is mandatory! Nice guy, really recommend this class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Rudy is a good professor. I enjoyed the topics being covered, although they can be kind of boring at times. He can speak in a very boring monotone voice that can put you to sleep easily. He asks you to read from the book but theyre not mandatory.

Dr. Rudy is a great guy and I would definitely take his class again. Two tests, minute papers(which is just a summary of what happened in class-really easy), and a major essay. The essay isn't hard and he gives you a lot of notice/reminders about it. Overall great teacher.

This is an EASY class. The ones that said it was hard probs didn't look over their notes. Dr. Rudy is very nice, but his class was honestly so boring especially with his monotone voice. But again a very sweet man. You have some minute papers over what we discussed(easy),couple of quizzes(easy) & an essay. Honestly take him, an easy A for a gen ed!

This can be an easy class if you attend almost every class. There are not many assignments -- only 2 quizzes, 1 exam, 1 paper, a few minute papers, and attendance that you are graded on. However, all of the assignments are fairly easy. He is monotone so his lectures are a bit boring, but he is very kind.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: This is the most boring class I took all semester. Every  day was a full hour of lecture listening to Dr. Rudy's monotone voice. With that being said, this was also the easiest class I took this semester. Midterm-super easy. The insane reading assignments- not necessary to pass. If you want an easy class and dont mind boring, I would recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Rudy is a nice guy, but he is so monotonous and his lectures are SO boring and long. He doesn't really seem like he has any idea what he's actually talking about and his powerpoints are very unclear and confusing. Attendance is mandatory.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Really straightforward class. One exam which you get a study guide for. One paper for the final. 2 quizzes. Really easy enjoyable class. This professor is fair and awesome!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Every single class you're listening to him lecture a PowerPoint while you write as fast as you can to copy down the endless PowerPoint notes & occasionally you do "minute papers" where you write a paper in a minute over all the notes you just took w/o even having time to look over the notes. Midterm & final is basically your whole grade. Bad class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY
